Entries.default:
"Well, what have we here? A little sloop - lost and alone in the storm."

A surly, brutish looking captain stands stiff-backed before his crew. He scowls as he assesses you, his hair whipping about his ears in the wind.
"At least he asked."
"The storm's pretty loud. Did you say you're surrendering? How strange."
[Attack] "Fire all cannons, aim at the mouthy one."

"You've got a smart mouth on you. Careful - that'll get you killed faster than any blade."

He grins to show crooked teeth.
"Ready with arms and ammunition! Now board and take them, mates!"
"I don't have any quarrel with you. Why do you want my ship?"
"Why complicate this with a quarrel? I see, I want, I take. It's simple as that."
"Give her up easy, and I'll see you get a swift death. It'll be bloody and agonizing, sure. But at least it'd be quick."
[Make a rude hand gesture.]
"Is that supposed to provoke me? No, I won't be riled by the likes of you."
Edér smiles like he's just seen an old friend.
"I'm going to mount your skull in my cabin."
The captain tilts his head, staring impassively as the wind and rain whip at his scarred face. Even across the distance, you can make out the roughness of his expression - muscles in his jaw bulging.
"And then he's going to wear his breeches on his head and dance for us? Did I hear that right?"
"You know, I always thought that room was missing something."

"Now then, me and my mates'll be helping ourselves to your ship. There's no need to see her sunk by the storms - or my culverins." 

With a grunt, he nods toward the port cannons.
"Listen up, mates." He cracks his neck as he addresses his crew.
"Aye, but the breeches are going to be stitched from your skin."
"I am a gentleman of fortune." The captain shrugs in the sheeting rain before pinning you with a slow, murderous grin.
"I'll be taking your ship now, if you don't mind. And especially if you do."
"Pirates?!"
"In the blood and flesh, aye, that I am. And you - you're a drowned man."
Entries.female: "In the blood and flesh, aye, that I am. And you - you're a dead woman."

Entries.default: "Now you're getting it." He spits over the side of the deck.
"Play with the crew if you'd like. But don't bring me any prisoners. None that're alive."

"Oh, I like your spirit." He laughs long and loud over the din of the howling rain. 

Then he sobers, instantly, his face a mask of rage.
"But that won't spare you none."
"I'm off to spear me a bigger fish. One with sharper teeth, like. I'm trusting you lot not to cock this up. DON'T damage the sloop when you take it."
"Always liked that one. Sometimes I like to wiggle the finger like it's tickling."
"Must be nice to get paid to talk so much."
"And you're the one who'll be paying me. Ain't that just lovely?"
"As if I would ever surrender to a common pirate."
"Who says I'm common? You've got the honor of being plundered by the fourth highest-ranking pirate in the Príncipi."
